message: This is a question I've had ever since I've started in on Dramatica: Do sequential signposts have to be about the same topic? In other words, if SS Signpost 1 is Conceiving and the idea they come up with is "we need to work better together" and then Signpost 2 is Conceptualizing, does that mean the characters in the SS need to be clashing over how to implement THAT plan (as in, "what are the actual details of working better together") OR can they clash over developing ANY plan... like, could two architects trying to work better together argue over the plans to a building? Or, could they clash over the details of getting their office on board with some new plan?

In my particular case, the Concern is Becoming --> does every signpost (and journey) need to be a different angle on that specific concern?

I have two characters that are in a bad, unworkable relationship that does indeed become a functional one at the end of the movie. But, the throughline is weak.

(Ironically and accidentally, at Signpost 2 they are both arguing over a plan, and clashing over how the two of them are supposed to be working together, so I have my bases covered there....)

Any.  That's one reason you can get episodic feeling stories.

Generally, however, there will be some consistent subject matter explored in the story, though the specifics can vary.
